Step9.Prompt:
Click the button below to set Adventurer creation to complete. You will no longer see the "Adventurer Creation" button in the Actor Sheet header.

Enjoy your adventures and may the Gods and spirits be with you!

Attributes.CreatureExplanation: Creatures have zero for all skill category modifiers

Combat.StrDexMinsNotMetTip: Character does not meet STR and/or DEX minimums for this weapon.  Use at half skill chance.
Combat.StrMinNotMetTip: Character does not meet STR minimum for this weapon. Use at half skill chance.
Combat.DexMinNotMetTip: Character does not meet DEX minimum for this weapon. STR over STR minimum can make up for this at two points of STR for one point of DEX, or use at half skill chance.
Combat.SRTooltip:
Strike Rank Modifiers

  • Augmenting +0
  • Prepare new spell or different weapon +5
  • Reload missile +5
  • Getting up from prone position +5
  • Surprised by foe within 3 m / yards +3
  • Surprised by foe within 4-9 m / yards +1
  • Movement: each 3 m / yards +1
  • Magic points used after first (which is free) +1

BatchRqidEditor.Title: Batch set System ID (Rqid)
BatchRqidEditor.SummaryDefault: The RQG System uses a System ID (Rqid). This allows the system to identify FoundryVTT documents like skills and runes. This page allows you to set the id for existing {type} documents that do not yet have a Rqid. The Rqid should use the English translation of the name to support localization across all languages.
BatchRqidEditor.SummarySkill:
The RQG System uses a System ID (Rqid). This allows the system to identify FoundryVTT documents for example skills. This page will allow you to set the id for existing skill documents that do not yet have a Rqid. The Rqid should use the English translation of the name to support localization across all languages.

Currently only the weapon skills and 'Dodge', 'Jump', 'Move Quietly' & 'Spirit Combat' need a Rqid so the others can be left blank.
BatchRqidEditor.SummaryRuneMagic:
The RQG System uses a System ID (Rqid). This allows the system to identify FoundryVTT documents for example skills. This page will allow you to set the id for existing rune magic documents that do not yet have a Rqid. The Rqid should use the English translation of the name to support localization across all languages.

Currently only the common rune magic spells need a Rqid (Command Cult Spirit, Divination, Sanctify, Summon Cult Spirit, Dismiss Magic, Extension, Multispell, Find Enemy, Heal Wound, Soul Sight, Spirit Block, and Warding)

confirmTransferPhysicalItem.title: Really give {itemName} to {targetActor}?
confirmTransferPhysicalItem.ReallyGiveItemSingle: Really give {itemName} to {targetActor}?  It will be removed from {sourceActor}'s inventory.
confirmTransferPhysicalItem.ReallyGiveItemQuantity: Really give {itemName} to {targetActor}?  It will be removed from {sourceActor}'s inventory, or {sourceActor}'s inventory quantity will be reduced.
confirmTransferPhysicalItem.GiveHowMany: Give how many {itemName} to {targetActor}?  {sourceActor}'s inventory of this item will be reduced by the amount chosen, or the item will be deleted if you choose to give the maximum amount of {maxQty}.

confirmItemDeleteDialog.title: Delete {itemType}: {itemName}
confirmItemDeleteDialog.content: Are you sure you want to delete the {itemType} named {itemName}?
confirmItemDeleteDialog.contentCult: Are you sure you want to delete the {itemType} named {itemName}? This will also delete all of the {runeMagicSpell} items associated with this {itemType}.

improveAbilityDialog.title: Improvement for {typeLocName} "{name}"
improveAbilityDialog.noExperienceCheckExplanation: This character does not have an experience check in this {typeLocName} and may not improve from Experience.
improveAbilityDialog.skillOver75Explanation: You may not train in skills with a value over 75%.
improveAbilityDialog.speciesMaxExplanation: You are at or above the species maximum for {name} and may not gain any more.

experienceRoll.flavor: {actorName} makes an experience improvement check for {typeLocName} "{name}"
experienceRoll.contentSkill: Roll 1d100 and add the skill category modifier ({mod}) and gain if the modified roll is HIGHER than the {typeLocName} "{name}" value {skillChance}% or 100.
experienceRoll.contentOther: Roll 1d100 and gain if the roll is HIGHER than the {typeLocName} "{name}" value of {chance}%
experienceRoll.contentChar: Roll 1d100 and gain if the roll is LOWER THAN OR EQUAL TO {chanceToGain}%.  This is based on the Species Maximum for the Characteristic of {speciesMax} minus the Characteristic "{name}" value of {chance} times five.

experienceGainFailed.content: {actorName} failed to learn from experience and the experience check has been cleared from {typeLocName} "{name}".

researchRoll.flavor: {actorName} makes a research improvement check for {typeLocName} "{name}"
researchRoll.contentChar: Roll 1d100 and gain if the roll is LOWER THAN OR EQUAL TO {chanceToGain}%.  This is based on the Species Maximum for the Characteristic of {speciesMax} minus the Characteristic "{name}" value of {chance} times five.

notifications.noExperience: {actorName} does not have an experience check in {typeLocName} "{name}" and cannot gain from experience now.

Game.RollTitle: Roll via Dialog (click), Direct Roll (dbl click)

AttackParryResults.0-0:
Attacker rolls normal damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon takes 1 HP damage if rolled damage is greater than its current HP. Any excess damage goes to affected hit location.
AttackParryResults.0-1:
Attacker inflicts max special damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon takes 1 HP damage if rolled damage is greater than its current HP. Any excess damage goes to adjacent hit location, with no armor protection.
AttackParryResults.0-2:
Attacker inflicts max special damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon HP reduced by the damage rolled. Any excess damage goes to adjacent hit location, with no armor protection.
AttackParryResults.0-3:
Attacker inflicts max special damage.
Defender takes damage, with no armor protection.
AttackParryResults.0-4:
Attacker automatically hits, does maximum special damage.
Defender takes damage, with no armor protection, and rolls on Fumbles table.
AttackParryResults.1-0:
Attack parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s normal damage. Attacking weapon’s HP is reduced by 1 HP if damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.1-1:
Attacker rolls normal damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon takes 1HP damage if damage more than its current HP. Any excess damage goes to the affected hit location.
AttackParryResults.1-2:
Attacker rolls special damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon takes damage over its HP, with same amount of damage going to adjacent hit location.
AttackParryResults.1-4:
Attacker causes special damage.
Defender takes damage and rolls on Fumbles table.
AttackParryResults.2-0:
Attack parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s special damage. Attacking weapon’s HP is reduced by any damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.2-1:
Attack parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s normal damage. Attacking weapon’s HP is reduced by 1 HP if damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.2-2:
Attacker rolls normal damage.
Defender’s parrying weapon takes 1 HP damage if damage more than its current HP. Any excess damage goes to the affected hit location.
AttackParryResults.2-4:
Attacker rolls normal damage.
Defender takes damage and rolls on Fumbles table.
AttackParryResults.3-0:
Attack parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s special damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by the damage rolled.
AttackParryResults.3-1:
Attacker parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s special damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by any damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.3-2:
Attacker parried or deflected.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s normal damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by 1 HP if damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.3-4:
Attacker rolls normal damage.
Defender takes damage and rolls on Fumbles table.
AttackParryResults.4-0:
Attacker rolls on Fumbles table.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s special damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by the damage rolled.
AttackParryResults.4-1:
Attacker rolls on Fumbles table.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s special damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by the damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.4-2:
Attacker rolls on Fumbles table.
Defender rolls parrying weapon’s normal damage. Attacking weapon’s HP reduced by 1 HP if damage over its current HP.
AttackParryResults.4-4:
Attacker rolls on Fumbles table.
Defender rolls on Fumbles table.

DodgeResults.0-2: Attack does special success damage, ignores armor.
DodgeResults.0-3: Attack does maximum special success damage, ignores armor.
DodgeResults.0-4:
Attack does maximum special success damage, ignores armor.
Defender rolls on Fumbles table.
DodgeResults.1-4:
Attack does special success damage.
Defender rolls on Fumbles table.
DodgeResults.2-4:
Attack does normal damage.
Defender rolls on Fumbles table.
DodgeResults.3-4:
Attack does normal damage.
Defender rolls on Fumbles table.
DodgeResults.4-4:
Attack fails and Attacker rolls on Fumbles table.
Defender roll on Fumbles table.

RQGSystem.GenerateDefaultRqid: Create RuneQuest System ID (rqid) based on current document. The rqid should be based on the english document name.
RQGSystem.CopyInputValue: Copy this value to the clipboard
RQGSystem.OtherDocumentsHeader: Documents with this rqid and language (excluding embedded documents)
RQGSystem.DuplicateWarning: Warning: Multiple rqids with same priority!
RQGSystem.CouldNotFindRune: Could not find cached rune with rqid {rqid}

Error.NoSheet: No sheet found for document linked to by RQG System ID (rqid) "{rqid}". See console log.
Error.MoreThanOneRqidMatchInWorld: More than one RQG Document in the world (not in compendium packs) matched the rqid "{rqid}", lang "{lang}", and priority "{priority}". Please review your RQG System settings.  See console log for item ids.
Error.MoreThanOneRqidMatchInPacks: More than one RQG Document in installed compendium packs matched the rqid "{rqid}", lang "{lang}", and priority "{priority}". Please review your RQG System settings.  See console log for item ids.
Error.DocumentNotFoundByRqid: Document not found in world or compendium packs matching the rqid "{rqid}", and lang "{lang}". See console log.

Error.GMOnlyOperation: This operation is only allowed for GMs

Warn.NameGenRqidNotSupported: Name Generation: The RQG System ID "{rqid}" is not supported for name generation.
Warn.NameGenRqidNotFound: Name Generation: The RQG System ID "{rqid}" was not found as a Roll Table or Journal Entry or the Journal Entry was not formatted properly as a Name Base.
Warn.NameBaseNotLongEnough: Name Generation: The RQG System ID "{rqid}" references a Name Base Journal Entry that was not long enough to generate a name after {attempts} attempts.  Consider adding more entries.

SortHitLocationsLowToHigh.settingHint: Activating this setting sorts the character hitlocation in the same way as stat blocks are sorted with the lowest die number first. The setting can be toggled in the actor sheet Health table.

DefaultItemIcons.settingLabel: Configure Default Icons for new Items
DefaultItemIcons.settingHint: Set the default icons used when creating new items.

WorldLanguage.settingHint: This is the language the game will be played in. It affects which compendium packs and journal descriptions are shown. It is recommended, but not strictly necessary, that all players have this language selected as their 'Core Settings Language Preference'.

FumbleRollTable.settingHint: The name of the Fumble roll table - will be used in combat

ShowHeropoints.settingHint: Show an input field to track the optional rule of hero points.

WorldMigrationVersion.settingHint: The RQG system version this world has been migrated to.

ShowCharacteristicRatings.settingHint: Show a colored rating bar below characteristics which rates the value as compared to the dice expression formula for the characteristic.  Red is lower than average and green is higher than average.  This can help you to judge an actor's strengths and weaknesses at a glance.

Dialog.migrationWarning: The version of this world ({worldVersion}) does not match the RQG system ({systemVersion}). Running this world migration will change the data in your world to what the system expects. Please make a backup of your world before proceeding, as you will not be able to undo this migration!
Dialog.migrationTime: The migration can take some time if you have a large world, but please be patient and do not shut the system down before it is finished.

Migration.WorldNotUpdated: This world is not updated to match the current system version ({systemVersion}). Please wait until your GM has done the update, then refresh this page (F5 or cmd-R).
Migration.applyingMigration: Applying World Migration to version {systemVersion}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.

UI.MultipleCults:
Character has more cults,
see Rune Magic Tab

SprintMultiplier.Name: Sprint Speed Multiplier
SprintMultiplier.Hint: This is for the optional rule that allows sprinting longer than MOV in certain situations. For example a MOV 8 character with a speed multiplier of 3 would be able to sprint 8 MOV * 3m * 3 multiplier = 72m. Set it to 0 to disable it.
